transcript.text: Good morning ^^
It's time for another morning routine vlog before Autumn,
a thirty-days long goodbye to summer.
"Good morning my love."
"Today's morning is so cold, isn't it?"
"Yeah."
"In my dream, there was a train that keeps running around and around."
We cross ventilate the house every morning to bring in fresh air.
At the end of summer, it's chilly at night and hot during the day.
It's bedding change and wash's day!
We change and wash bedding once a week.
We don't use fabric softener,
but use baking soda and essential oils instead.
It's only 15 °C this morning
so I'm craving for some warm, comfort food.
Braised tofu with egg sound yummy!
Sautee the tofu for 3-4 minutes each side.
For the sauce: Finely chop half an onion
1 minced garlic cloves
1.5 Tbsp soy sauce
1/2 Tbsp mirin
1/2 cup water
1 Tsp brown sugar
Pour in the sauce,
Simmer the tofu for 10 minutes.
Add eggs and cover until the egg whites are cooked
and the yolks are still slightly runny (2-3 minutes).
Some pickled radish I made the other days.
Rice cooked from yesterday before going to bed.
Summer abundance in our vegetable garden!
But this morning I will only harvest just a little for lunch/dinner.
Hopefully it won't be too cold anytime soon,
so we could keep harvesting well into October ^^
Making breakfast to pack for Alexia before waking her up.
Routines may sound "boring",
and the antithesis to what we’re told a “good life” is made of.
Yet we human love routines and schedules.
Why?
Maybe because having a routine doesn’t necessarily mean
doing the same thing every day at the exact same time...
It could be being routinely un-routine.
Maybe because habits create our mood,
and our mood is a filter through which we experience our life.
By doing so, we learn to let our conscious decisions dictate our day
– not our fears or impulses.
With no regulation, focus, base or self-control,
anything can trick me into dark corner that I'm scared to be in.
I realized happiness is not how many things we do,
but how well we do them.
Happiness is not experiencing something else,
it’s continually experiencing what we already have,
in new and different ways.
Alexia has learnt how to ride a bike recently
so from now on she's biking to kindergarden with her dad.
This is good for kid.
They will experience an increase in their physical activity.
They will develope a feeling of independence.
Practicing balance and coordination movements.
Learning how to choose and stay on a route,
and attaining knowledge regarding traffic safety.
If your child is young, accompany them on their bike rides
until they are confident and experienced enough to ride alone.
We plan a safe, peaceful route to the kindergarten.
She loves this route and expressed how beautiful it is many times.
I think a good bike route will motivate kid to stay more commited.
We taught her basic traffic rules,
like stopping at stop signs/red traffic lights,
using hand signals to indicate turns,
and looking both ways before crossing intersections.
In Germany, lots of kids are biking to school in summer.
In this small countryside haven,
morning light is not merely a transition from dark to day.
It's a reminder that even in the simplest corners of the world,
there exists a beauty that transcends time,
and that every dawn holds the promise of a new story waiting to unfold.
A 30-minute morning bike ride to start our day.
Remember that every stage in parenthood is transient.
The newborn phase is not forever,
the toddler phase is not forever,
it's about being comfortable with the fact that things are going to change.
The key for a couple is to stay connected,
to focus on our relationship and restore any lost intimacy.
Embrace the little moments like this bike ride.
Before kids, it was easy to take those moments for granted.
Once they're born, it's imperative to acknowledge
and appreciate the little things that help get us through the day.
By making an effort to focus on your relationship after kids,
we'll help rekindle emotional intimacy, strengthen our bond,
and remind each other
that we're still the same couple we were before kids.
Our relationship is at the core of everything.
We need to invest in it just as much as we do parenthood.
Always make time for self-care.
Do what makes you and your partner happy.
The rest doesn’t matter.
Because happy parents lead to happy childhoods.
Let's air dry the bouquet T made for me.
What's better than a cold maracuja drink on a hot summer day?
Fresh maracuja juice, honey, elderberry syrup, butterfly pea tea.
The feel of summer: the smells, the sights, the sounds...
The textures, tastes, aromas, and temperatures
experienced by preparing and eating food and drink
is a sensory experience that goes beyond our “nutritional” need.
Those experiences last forever
and are powerful connections to our memories & emotions.
When we smell something like the cookies our mom made,
or the taste of the drink you love growing up every summer.
This morning I want to work on curtains for my kitchen island.
These samples are beautiful,
now having them in my hand and knowing they look good,
I'm going ahead and order this one
I will keep you updated on this project ;)
